title: Demi Lovato 'crushed' after close friend's death: 'Addiction is NO joke'
text:
CLOSE Christina Aguilera celebrates her Grammy nomination for her duet with Demi Lovato, calling the singer "an admirable young female who is figuring her own stuff out." (Jan. 30) AP

Demi Lovato is heartbroken over the death of a close friend, whom she said lost his battle with addiction.

The 27-year-old singer, who was hospitalized in the summer of 2018 following an apparent drug overdose, grieved the loss on her Instagram Stories Wednesday.

"Devastated. Please hold your loved ones tight," Lovato wrote beneath a picture of her friend. "Tell them they are special and that you love them. Make sure they know it. RIP to my boo @sirtruss 🖤🖤🖤"

In a second story, the artist told her followers: "Addiction is NO joke.. heaven gained this beautiful angel last night because of that terrible disease.

"I’m crushed and will always miss you @sirtruss," she continued. "If you or someone you know is struggling please know it’s okay to ask for help."

On July 24, 2018, an ambulance rushed Lovato to the hospital, just a month after the singer admitted in her single "Sober" that she'd relapsed following six years of sobriety.

Lovato broke her silence two weeks later, writing in a since-deleted Instagram post, "I want to thank God for keeping me alive and well. I have always been transparent about my journey with addiction. What I’ve learned is that this illness is not something that disappears or fades with time. It is something I must continue to overcome and have not done yet."

She reportedly entered a rehab facility in August, and rang in the New Year with an appreciation for life.

"So grateful for the lessons I’ve learned this year," she wrote on her Instagram Story. "I will never take another day in life for granted, even the bad ones."
